http://schema.org/citation.description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

http://schema.org/securityScreening.description: The type of security screening the passenger is subject to.

http://schema.org/episodeNumber.description: Position of the episode within an ordered group of episodes.

http://schema.org/drugUnit.description: The unit in which the drug is measured, e.g. '5 mg tablet'.

http://schema.org/accessibilityFeature.description: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

http://schema.org/softwareRequirements.description: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime). Supersedes requirements.

http://schema.org/bodyLocation.description: Location in the body of the anatomical structure.

http://schema.org/accessCode.description: Password, PIN, or access code needed for delivery (e.g. from a locker).

http://schema.org/playerType.description: Player type required—for example, Flash or Silverlight.

http://schema.org/printPage.description: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the name of the page on which the article is found. Please note that this field is intended for the exact page name (e.g. A5, B18).

http://schema.org/areaServed.description: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided. Supersedes serviceArea.

http://schema.org/addressCountry.description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

http://schema.org/vehicleIdentificationN.description: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is a unique serial number used by the automotive industry to identify individual motor vehicles.

http://schema.org/streetAddress.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

http://schema.org/educationalUse.description: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

http://schema.org/activityFrequency.description: How often one should engage in the activity.

http://schema.org/audienceType.description: The target group associated with a given audience (e.g. veterans, car owners, musicians, etc.).

http://schema.org/applicationCategory.description: Type of software application, e.g. "Game, Multimedia".

http://schema.org/countriesNotSupported.description: Countries for which the application is not supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

http://schema.org/videoFrameSize.description: The frame size of the video.

http://schema.org/broadcastChannelId.description: The unique address by which the BroadcastService can be identified in a provider lineup. In US, this is typically a number.

http://schema.org/activeIngredient.description: An active ingredient, typically chemical compounds and/or biologic substances.

http://schema.org/functionalClass.description: The degree of mobility the joint allows.

http://schema.org/preOp.description: A description of the workup, testing, and other preparations required before implanting this device.

http://schema.org/possibleComplication.description: A possible unexpected and unfavorable evolution of a medical condition. Complications may include worsening of the signs or symptoms of the disease, extension of the condition to other organ systems, etc.

http://schema.org/position.description: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

http://schema.org/vehicleTransmission.description: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

http://schema.org/followup.description: Typical or recommended followup care after the procedure is performed.

http://schema.org/printSection.description: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the print section in which the article appeared.

http://schema.org/category.description: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

http://schema.org/serialNumber.description: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

http://schema.org/alignmentType.description: A category of alignment between the learning resource and the framework node. Recommended values include: 'assesses', 'teaches', 'requires', 'textComplexity', 'readingLevel', 'educationalSubject', and 'educationLevel'.

http://schema.org/busName.description: The name of the bus (e.g. Bolt Express).

http://schema.org/pregnancyWarning.description: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to this drug's use during pregnancy.

http://schema.org/text.description: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

http://schema.org/algorithm.description: The algorithm or rules to follow to compute the score.

http://schema.org/bitrate.description: The bitrate of the media object.

http://schema.org/polygon.description: A polygon is the area enclosed by a point-to-point path for which the starting and ending points are the same. A polygon is expressed as a series of four or more space delimited points where the first and final points are identical.

http://schema.org/requiredGender.description: Audiences defined by a person's gender.

http://schema.org/seatSection.description: The section location of the reserved seat (e.g. Orchestra).

http://schema.org/artworkSurface.description: The supporting materials for the artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc. Supersedes surface.

http://schema.org/jobTitle.description: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

http://schema.org/significance.description: The significance associated with the superficial anatomy; as an example, how characteristics of the superficial anatomy can suggest underlying medical conditions or courses of treatment.

http://schema.org/restPeriods.description: How often one should break from the activity.

http://schema.org/musicCompositionForm.description: The type of composition (e.g. overture, sonata, symphony, etc.).

http://schema.org/reservationId.description: A unique identifier for the reservation.

http://schema.org/honorificSuffix.description: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.

http://schema.org/reportNumber.description: The number or other unique designator assigned to a Report by the publishing organization.

http://schema.org/infectiousAgent.description: The actual infectious agent, such as a specific bacterium.

http://schema.org/targetName.description: The name of a node in an established educational framework.

http://schema.org/itemListElement.description: For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem. Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists. Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements. Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

http://schema.org/qualifications.description: Specific qualifications required for this role.

http://schema.org/serviceType.description: The type of service being offered, e.g. veterans' benefits, emergency relief, etc.

http://schema.org/arrivalGate.description: Identifier of the flight's arrival gate.

http://schema.org/featureList.description: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).

http://schema.org/costOrigin.description: Additional details to capture the origin of the cost data. For example, 'Medicare Part B'.

http://schema.org/procedure.description: A description of the procedure involved in setting up, using, and/or installing the device.

http://schema.org/actionOption.description: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action. Supersedes option.

http://schema.org/contentRating.description: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

http://schema.org/priceRange.description: The price range of the business, for example $$$.

http://schema.org/lodgingUnitType.description: Textual description of the unit type (including suite vs. room, size of bed, etc.).

http://schema.org/breastfeedingWarning.description: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to this drug's use by breastfeeding mothers.

http://schema.org/cookingMethod.description: The method of cooking, such as Frying, Steaming, ...

http://schema.org/iswcCode.description: The International Standard Musical Work Code for the composition.

http://schema.org/outcome.description: Expected or actual outcomes of the study.

http://schema.org/subtitleLanguage.description: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in IETF BCP 47 standard format.

http://schema.org/naturalProgression.description: The expected progression of the condition if it is not treated and allowed to progress naturally.

http://schema.org/discountCode.description: Code used to redeem a discount.

http://schema.org/productSupported.description: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").

http://schema.org/subStageSuffix.description: The substage, e.g. 'a' for Stage IIIa.

http://schema.org/model.description: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

http://schema.org/priceCurrency.description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

http://schema.org/propertyID.description: A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property, e.g. a manufacturer or a standard code for a property. propertyID can be(1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific id of the property), or (3)a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g. a glossary entry).Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.

http://schema.org/box.description: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character.

http://schema.org/industry.description: The industry associated with the job position.

http://schema.org/learningResourceType.description: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

http://schema.org/httpMethod.description: An HTTP method that specifies the appropriate HTTP method for a request to an HTTP EntryPoint. Values are capitalized strings as used in HTTP.

http://schema.org/value.description: The value of the quantitative value or property value node. For QuantitativeValue, the recommended type for values is 'Number'. For PropertyValue, it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.

http://schema.org/mealService.description: Description of the meals that will be provided or available for purchase.

http://schema.org/seatRow.description: The row location of the reserved seat (e.g., B).

http://schema.org/clipNumber.description: Position of the clip within an ordered group of clips.

http://schema.org/pathophysiology.description: Changes in the normal mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions that are associated with this activity or condition.

http://schema.org/pageEnd.description: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

http://schema.org/doseUnit.description: The unit of the dose, e.g. 'mg'.

http://schema.org/lowPrice.description: The lowest price of all offers available.

http://schema.org/employmentType.description: Type of employment (e.g. full-time, part-time, contract, temporary, seasonal, internship).

http://schema.org/fuelType.description: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

http://schema.org/gtin8.description: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

http://schema.org/accessibilityAPI.description: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

http://schema.org/bestRating.description: The highest value allowed in this rating system. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.

http://schema.org/accountId.description: The identifier for the account the payment will be applied to.

http://schema.org/issn.description: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this periodical. You can repeat this property to (for example) identify different formats of this periodical.

http://schema.org/reviewBody.description: The actual body of the review.

http://schema.org/warning.description: Any FDA or other warnings about the drug (text or URL).

http://schema.org/volumeNumber.description: Identifies the volume of publication or multi-part work; for example, "iii" or "2".

http://schema.org/fileFormat.description: Media type (aka MIME format, see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information.

http://schema.org/latitude.description: The latitude of a location. For example 37.42242 (WGS 84).

http://schema.org/inLanguage.description: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. Supersedes language.

http://schema.org/suggestedGender.description: The gender of the person or audience.

http://schema.org/boardingGroup.description: The airline-specific indicator of boarding order / preference.

http://schema.org/broadcastTimezone.description: The timezone in ISO 8601 format for which the service bases its broadcasts.

http://schema.org/seatNumber.description: The location of the reserved seat (e.g., 27).

http://schema.org/releaseNotes.description: Description of what changed in this version.

http://schema.org/risks.description: Specific physiologic risks associated to the plan.

http://schema.org/countriesSupported.description: Countries for which the application is supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

http://schema.org/experienceRequirements.description: Description of skills and experience needed for the position.

http://schema.org/dietFeatures.description: Nutritional information specific to the dietary plan. May include dietary recommendations on what foods to avoid, what foods to consume, and specific alterations/deviations from the USDA or other regulatory body's approved dietary guidelines.

http://schema.org/discountCurrency.description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the discount.

http://schema.org/publicationType.description: The type of the medical article, taken from the US NLM MeSH publication type catalog.

http://schema.org/tickerSymbol.description: The exchange traded instrument associated with a Corporation object. The tickerSymbol is expressed as an exchange and an instrument name separated by a space character. For the exchange component of the tickerSymbol attribute, we reccommend using the controlled vocaulary of Market Identifier Codes (MIC) specified in ISO15022.

http://schema.org/artMedium.description: The material used. (e.g. Oil, Watercolour, Acrylic, Linoprint, Marble, Cyanotype, Digital, Lithograph, DryPoint, Intaglio, Pastel, Woodcut, Pencil, Mixed Media, etc.) Supersedes material.

http://schema.org/runtimePlatform.description: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0). Supersedes runtime.

http://schema.org/valuePattern.description: Specifies a regular expression for testing literal values according to the HTML spec.

http://schema.org/gamePlatform.description: The electronic systems used to play video games.

http://schema.org/unitText.description: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code forunitCode.

http://schema.org/roleName.description: A role played, performed or filled by a person or organization. For example, the team of creators for a comic book might fill the roles named 'inker', 'penciller', and 'letterer'; or an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'. Supersedes namedPosition.

http://schema.org/catalogNumber.description: The catalog number for the release.

http://schema.org/highPrice.description: The highest price of all offers available.

http://schema.org/contentType.description: The supported content type(s) for an EntryPoint response.

http://schema.org/nonProprietaryName.description: The generic name of this drug or supplement.

http://schema.org/lodgingUnitDescription.description: A full description of the lodging unit.

http://schema.org/targetDescription.description: The description of a node in an established educational framework.

http://schema.org/safetyConsideration.description: Any potential safety concern associated with the supplement. May include interactions with other drugs and foods, pregnancy, breastfeeding, known adverse reactions, and documented efficacy of the supplement.

http://schema.org/recommendationStrength.description: Strength of the guideline's recommendation (e.g. 'class I').

http://schema.org/proficiencyLevel.description: Proficiency needed for this content; expected values: 'Beginner', 'Expert'.

http://schema.org/passengerPriorityStatu.description: The priority status assigned to a passenger for security or boarding (e.g. FastTrack or Priority).

http://schema.org/exerciseType.description: Type(s) of exercise or activity, such as strength training, flexibility training, aerobics, cardiac rehabilitation, etc.

http://schema.org/executableLibraryName.description: Library file name e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll. Supersedes assembly.

http://schema.org/recipeCuisine.description: The cuisine of the recipe (for example, French or Ethiopian).

http://schema.org/incentiveCompensation.description: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job. Supersedes incentives.

http://schema.org/artform.description: e.g. Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Print, Photograph, Assemblage, Collage, etc.

http://schema.org/description.description: A short description of the item.

http://schema.org/salaryCurrency.description: The currency (coded using ISO 4217, http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217 ) used for the main salary information in this job posting or for this employee.

http://schema.org/currenciesAccepted.description: The currency accepted (in ISO 4217 currency format).

http://schema.org/vehicleInteriorColor.description: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

http://schema.org/alcoholWarning.description: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to consumption of alcohol while taking this drug.

http://schema.org/transmissionMethod.description: How the disease spreads, either as a route or vector, for example 'direct contact', 'Aedes aegypti', etc.

http://schema.org/taxID.description: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

http://schema.org/background.description: Descriptive information establishing a historical perspective on the supplement. May include the rationale for the name, the population where the supplement first came to prominence, etc.

http://schema.org/estimatedFlightDuratio.description: The estimated time the flight will take.

http://schema.org/breadcrumb.description: A set of links that can help a user understand and navigate a website hierarchy.

http://schema.org/frequency.description: How often the dose is taken, e.g. 'daily'.

http://schema.org/educationRequirements.description: Educational background needed for the position.

http://schema.org/ticketToken.description: Reference to an asset (e.g., Barcode, QR code image or PDF) usable for entrance.

http://schema.org/iataCode.description: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.

http://schema.org/arrivalPlatform.description: The platform where the train arrives.

http://schema.org/population.description: Any characteristics of the population used in the study, e.g. 'males under 65'.

http://schema.org/clinicalPharmacology.description: Description of the absorption and elimination of drugs, including their concentration (pharmacokinetics, pK) and biological effects (pharmacodynamics, pD). Supersedes clincalPharmacology.

http://schema.org/schemaVersion.description: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using a URL such as http://schema.org/version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.

http://schema.org/intensity.description: Quantitative measure gauging the degree of force involved in the exercise, for example, heartbeats per minute. May include the velocity of the movement.

http://schema.org/permissions.description: Permission(s) required to run the app (for example, a mobile app may require full internet access or may run only on wifi).

http://schema.org/targetPlatform.description: Type of app development: phone, Metro style, desktop, XBox, etc.

http://schema.org/valueName.description: Indicates the name of the PropertyValueSpecification to be used in URL templates and form encoding in a manner analogous to HTML's input@name.

http://schema.org/addressLocality.description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

http://schema.org/vatID.description: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

http://schema.org/characterName.description: The name of a character played in some acting or performing role, i.e. in a PerformanceRole.

http://schema.org/dosageForm.description: A dosage form in which this drug/supplement is available, e.g. 'tablet', 'suspension', 'injection'.

http://schema.org/isrcCode.description: The International Standard Recording Code for the recording.

http://schema.org/dependencies.description: Prerequisites needed to fulfill steps in article.

http://schema.org/accessibilityControl.description: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

http://schema.org/targetPopulation.description: Characteristics of the population for which this is intended, or which typically uses it, e.g. 'adults'.

http://schema.org/knownVehicleDamages.description: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

http://schema.org/providerMobility.description: Indicates the mobility of a provided service (e.g. 'static', 'dynamic').

http://schema.org/ticketNumber.description: The unique identifier for the ticket.

http://schema.org/postOp.description: A description of the postoperative procedures, care, and/or followups for this device.

http://schema.org/trainNumber.description: The unique identifier for the train.

http://schema.org/priceType.description: A short text or acronym indicating multiple price specifications for the same offer, e.g. SRP for the suggested retail price or INVOICE for the invoice price, mostly used in the car industry.

http://schema.org/proprietaryName.description: Proprietary name given to the diet plan, typically by its originator or creator.

http://schema.org/jobBenefits.description: Description of benefits associated with the job. Supersedes benefits.

http://schema.org/tissueSample.description: The type of tissue sample required for the test.

http://schema.org/muscleAction.description: The movement the muscle generates. Supersedes action.

http://schema.org/encodingType.description: The supported encoding type(s) for an EntryPoint request.

http://schema.org/openingHours.description: The opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'.- Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr, Sa, Su.- Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as 15:00. - Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. - If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

http://schema.org/recipeYield.description: The quantity produced by the recipe (for example, number of people served, number of servings, etc).

http://schema.org/artEdition.description: The number of copies when multiple copies of a piece of artwork are produced - e.g. for a limited edition of 20 prints, 'artEdition' refers to the total number of copies (in this example "20").

http://schema.org/videoFormat.description: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

http://schema.org/overdosage.description: Any information related to overdose on a drug, including signs or symptoms, treatments, contact information for emergency response.

http://schema.org/legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

http://schema.org/givenName.description: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

http://schema.org/globalLocationNumber.description: The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

http://schema.org/line.description: A line is a point-to-point path consisting of two or more points. A line is expressed as a series of two or more point objects separated by space.

http://schema.org/keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

http://schema.org/familyName.description: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

http://schema.org/pagination.description: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

http://schema.org/longitude.description: The longitude of a location. For example -122.08585 (WGS 84).

http://schema.org/foodWarning.description: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to consumption of specific foods while taking this drug.

http://schema.org/contactType.description: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

http://schema.org/browserRequirements.description: Specifies browser requirements in human-readable text. For example,"requires HTML5 support".

http://schema.org/educationalFramework.description: The framework to which the resource being described is aligned.

http://schema.org/subtype.description: A more specific type of the condition, where applicable, for example 'Type 1 Diabetes', 'Type 2 Diabetes', or 'Gestational Diabetes' for Diabetes.

http://schema.org/seasonNumber.description: Position of the season within an ordered group of seasons.

http://schema.org/costPerUnit.description: The cost per unit of the drug.

http://schema.org/expectedPrognosis.description: The likely outcome in either the short term or long term of the medical condition.

http://schema.org/overview.description: Descriptive information establishing the overarching theory/philosophy of the plan. May include the rationale for the name, the population where the plan first came to prominence, etc.

http://schema.org/worstRating.description: The lowest value allowed in this rating system. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.

http://schema.org/vehicleConfiguration.description: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

http://schema.org/genre.description: Genre of the creative work or group.

http://schema.org/typicalAgeRange.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

http://schema.org/issueNumber.description: Identifies the issue of publication; for example, "iii" or "2".

http://schema.org/processorRequirements.description: Processor architecture required to run the application (e.g. IA64).

http://schema.org/epidemiology.description: The characteristics of associated patients, such as age, gender, race etc.

http://schema.org/physiologicalBenefits.description: Specific physiologic benefits associated to the plan.

http://schema.org/aspect.description: An aspect of medical practice that is considered on the page, such as 'diagnosis', 'treatment', 'causes', 'prognosis', 'etiology', 'epidemiology', etc.

http://schema.org/eligibleRegion.description: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid. See also ineligibleRegion.

http://schema.org/menu.description: Either the actual menu or a URL of the menu.

http://schema.org/skills.description: Skills required to fulfill this role.

http://schema.org/dataFeedElement.description: An item within in a data feed. Data feeds may have many elements.

http://schema.org/numberOfAirbags.description: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

http://schema.org/circle.description: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

http://schema.org/fileSize.description: Size of the application / package (e.g. 18MB). In the absence of a unit (MB, KB etc.), KB will be assumed.

http://schema.org/departurePlatform.description: The platform from which the train departs.

http://schema.org/trainName.description: The name of the train (e.g. The Orient Express).

http://schema.org/carrierRequirements.description: Specifies specific carrier(s) requirements for the application (e.g. an application may only work on a specific carrier network).

http://schema.org/arrivalTerminal.description: Identifier of the flight's arrival terminal.

http://schema.org/branchCode.description: A short textual code (also called "store code") that uniquely identifies a place of business. The code is typically assigned by the parentOrganization and used in structured URLs. For example, in the URL http://www.starbucks.co.uk/store-locator/etc/detail/3047 the code "3047" is a branchCode for a particular branch.

http://schema.org/dateline.description: The location where the NewsArticle was produced.

http://schema.org/broadcastDisplayName.description: The name displayed in the channel guide. For many US affiliates, it is the network name.

http://schema.org/urlTemplate.description: A url template (RFC6570) that will be used to construct the target of the execution of the action.

http://schema.org/membershipNumber.description: A unique identifier for the membership.

http://schema.org/price.description: The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes. Usage guidelines:Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value. Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator. Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting. Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

http://schema.org/programmingModel.description: Indicates whether API is managed or unmanaged.

http://schema.org/articleBody.description: The actual body of the article.

http://schema.org/structuralClass.description: The name given to how bone physically connects to each other.

http://schema.org/passengerSequenceNumbe.description: The passenger's sequence number as assigned by the airline.

http://schema.org/vehicleInteriorType.description: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.

http://schema.org/orderItemNumber.description: The identifier of the order item.

http://schema.org/expertConsiderations.description: Medical expert advice related to the plan.

http://schema.org/defaultValue.description: The default value of the input. For properties that expect a literal, the default is a literal value, for properties that expect an object, it's an ID reference to one of the current values.

http://schema.org/biomechnicalClass.description: The biomechanical properties of the bone.

http://schema.org/servingSize.description: The serving size, in terms of the number of volume or mass.

http://schema.org/actionPlatform.description: The high level platform(s) where the Action can be performed for the given URL. To specify a specific application or operating system instance, use actionApplication.

http://schema.org/alternativeHeadline.description: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

http://schema.org/honorificPrefix.description: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

http://schema.org/associatedPathophysiol.description: If applicable, a description of the pathophysiology associated with the anatomical system, including potential abnormal changes in the mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions of the system.

http://schema.org/mechanismOfAction.description: The specific biochemical interaction through which this drug or supplement produces its pharmacological effect.

http://schema.org/workHours.description: The typical working hours for this job (e.g. 1st shift, night shift, 8am-5pm).

http://schema.org/strengthUnit.description: The units of an active ingredient's strength, e.g. mg.

http://schema.org/geoRadius.description: Indicates the approximate radius of a GeoCircle (metres unless indicated otherwise via Distance notation).

http://schema.org/confirmationNumber.description: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

http://schema.org/duns.description: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

http://schema.org/paymentStatus.description: The status of payment; whether the invoice has been paid or not.

http://schema.org/paymentMethodId.description: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

http://schema.org/departureTerminal.description: Identifier of the flight's departure terminal.

http://schema.org/totalPrice.description: The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

http://schema.org/busNumber.description: The unique identifier for the bus.

http://schema.org/driveWheelConfiguratio.description: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.

http://schema.org/gtin13.description: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

http://schema.org/codeSampleType.description: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template. Supersedes sampleType.

http://schema.org/ineligibleRegion.description: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed. See also eligibleRegion.

http://schema.org/articleSection.description: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.

http://schema.org/transcript.description: If this MediaObject is an AudioObject or VideoObject, the transcript of that object.

http://schema.org/itemListOrder.description: Type of ordering (e.g. Ascending, Descending, Unordered).

http://schema.org/unitCode.description: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

http://schema.org/mpn.description: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

http://schema.org/additionalName.description: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

http://schema.org/printEdition.description: The edition of the print product in which the NewsArticle appears.

http://schema.org/broadcastServiceTier.description: The type of service required to have access to the channel (e.g. Standard or Premium).

http://schema.org/pageStart.description: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

http://schema.org/recipeInstructions.description: A step or instruction involved in making the recipe.

http://schema.org/additionalVariable.description: Any additional component of the exercise prescription that may need to be articulated to the patient. This may include the order of exercises, the number of repetitions of movement, quantitative distance, progressions over time, etc.

http://schema.org/availableOnDevice.description: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application. Supersedes device.

http://schema.org/naics.description: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

http://schema.org/evidenceOrigin.description: Source of the data used to formulate the guidance, e.g. RCT, consensus opinion, etc.

http://schema.org/recipeIngredient.description: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic. Supersedes ingredients.

http://schema.org/productID.description: The product identifier, such as ISBN. For example: <meta itemprop='productID' content='isbn:123-456-789'/>.

http://schema.org/musicalKey.description: The key, mode, or scale this composition uses.

http://schema.org/printColumn.description: The number of the column in which the NewsArticle appears in the print edition.

http://schema.org/location.description: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

http://schema.org/occupationalCategory.description: Category or categories describing the job. Use BLS O*NET-SOC taxonomy: http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html. Ideally includes textual label and formal code, with the property repeated for each applicable value.

http://schema.org/departureGate.description: Identifier of the flight's departure gate.

http://schema.org/query.description: A sub property of instrument. The query used on this action.

http://schema.org/preparation.description: Typical preparation that a patient must undergo before having the procedure performed.

http://schema.org/costCurrency.description: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the drug cost.

http://schema.org/normalRange.description: Range of acceptable values for a typical patient, when applicable.

http://schema.org/specialCommitments.description: Any special commitments associated with this job posting. Valid entries include VeteranCommit, MilitarySpouseCommit, etc.

http://schema.org/recipeCategory.description: The category of the recipe—for example, appetizer, entree, etc.

http://schema.org/administrationRoute.description: A route by which this drug may be administered, e.g. 'oral'.

http://schema.org/interactivityType.description: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

http://schema.org/gtin12.description: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

http://schema.org/currency.description: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format).

http://schema.org/gtin14.description: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

http://schema.org/postOfficeBoxNumber.description: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

http://schema.org/sku.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

http://schema.org/award.description: An award won by or for this item. Supersedes awards.

http://schema.org/flightNumber.description: The unique identifier for a flight including the airline IATA code. For example, if describing United flight 110, where the IATA code for United is 'UA', the flightNumber is 'UA110'.

http://schema.org/accessibilityHazard.description: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

http://schema.org/applicationSuite.description: The name of the application suite to which the application belongs (e.g. Excel belongs to Office).

http://schema.org/applicationSubCategory.description: Subcategory of the application, e.g. "Arcade Game".

http://schema.org/isicV4.description: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

http://schema.org/acceptsReservations.description: Indicates whether a FoodEstablishment accepts reservations. Values can be Boolean, a URL at which reservations can be made or (for backwards compatibility) the strings Yes or No.
